channel.title: Needing a book report
channel.description:
I need a book report over the book Cover-Up: mystery at the super bowl by john feinstein.
it needs to be in this format and its overall points are 200.
[code]GUIDELINES: Typed 12pt. Times New Roman Double Spaced 3 pages 1” Margins
Report should indent each new paragraph only five spaces. There should not be any extra spaces after the title, or between paragraphs. Paragraphs should NOT be numbered or labeled.[/code]
[code]Introduction: the introduction must have a thesis statement (the sentence that states what the rest of the report is going to be about). Provide background information to set up the rest of the report. You could include the setting. Introduction should be roughly 4 to 5 sentences in length.[/code]
[code]Character Analysis: Write a separate paragraph for each man character. The descriptions should be written in complete sentences in normal report format just like the rest of the report. Give an in depth description for each character including: physical description, personality traits, strengths, and weaknesses; how they deal with pressure, stress, and society. Try to look deeper into the character than just what the book tells you, use context clues to figure out what the character is really like.[/code]
[code]Plot Development: Give a brief summarization of the story, DO NOT GIVE PLAY-BY-PLAY detail of the story. You should focus on the man events of the story. I want you to explain how you relate these events to modern life. I want to know what you can take away from the book and how you interact with it. The following items should be evident in your report: how the events and instances relate to modern society, what moral or lesson can be learned, main topics and theme (examples from the story to support it), how do the events in the book affect other characters and the overall outcome of the story.[/code]
[code]Evaluation: The evaluation should be approximately one paragraph (four to five sentences). I want to see how you form opinions and critique literature. Point out some of the literary devices (metaphors, similes, irony, personification, etc.) you found in the story. How does the author’s use of these devices affect your overall understanding of the story?[/code]
date got expanded to friday the 17th..
also if you could just put it in a code tag when you have it finished seeing how i have to print it off at the school.

item.title: Needing a book report
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

If you have no reason to do it then why would anyone else have any reason to it?

It’s in your best interest to have it done and no-one else’s. This section is for help not for lazy niggers to ask for help with shit they can’t be arsed to because they’re out being cool getting community service sentences.

Grow the fuck up and sort out your life.

Read full topic

item.title: Needing a book report
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

[quote=“hasumon, post:12, topic:234463”][quote author=xstrxpurez link=topic=309127.msg2484655#msg2484655 date=1223749592]

I want to know what you can take away from the book and how you interact with it.

What kind of a fucking moronic teacher asks how you interact with a book?

one that thinks she is fucking smart… she teaches the same shit every year… doesn’t change any of it… and all my friends have had the same shit… and i got like 30 papers from them just to copy all to my work… and she gave me a C or lower on each one… and i said thats bull shit i got the papers from a friend and they got a 95% on it… and she was like u got a bad grade because you didnt bother to read it… and i was like… i did to read the damn shit… and told her what it was about and then she gave me a even lower grade…
[/quote]
Lesson here? READ IT OR JUST FAIL
Which is better? I rather do all the work than fail and become a bum living next to some trash bin waiting for the next trash bag full of shit and soda cans to collect and get some cheeseburgers at mcdonalds and drink my self happy from being a total loser.[/quote]
lame? i have read it before… and why do a book report? its 200pts… and if i dont get it done or have 1 i will just say that i dont wana do anything for her retarded ass class.

Read full topic

it needs to be in this format and its overall points are 200.

[code]GUIDELINES: Typed 12pt. Times New Roman

1” Margins

Introduction: the introduction must have a thesis statement (the sentence that states what the rest of the report is going to be about). Provide background information to set up the rest of the report. You could include the setting. Introduction should be roughly 4 to 5 sentences in length.
